description: This schema represents <name of measure>, Describe here the measure the schema represents and whether the schema represents a single measure or it can also represent an aggregate measure.

references.description: Additional details on the use of this template and an annotated sample application are available on the OmH website.
The XXX code represents yyy. Specify here the term from a standard vocabulary that best describes this measure.
Add any relevant references, for example the website or paper used to inform the definition of this measure.

definitions.description: List here the references to existing schemas that are used to define properties schema. The name should correspond to the schema name.

properties.description: List here the properties of this schema. Choose a meaningful name, which may be the same name used in the definitions section or slightly different, as in the case of effective_time_frame below.

unit_value.description: The value of the quantitative measure, together with the relevant unit of measure. Reference an existing specific unit value schema (for ex., mass-unit-value) or, if none applies, reference the generic unit value schema and then constrain the unit value set as appropriate. If the measure is expressed by a number, do not reference the unit-value schema, but define the relevant property to be of type number (see property section below).

effective_time_frame.description: The time frame to which the quantitative measure effectively refers.

description: Since additionalProperties is not specified, the default value (true) applies, which means data containing properties not listed in the relevant section will validate against this schema.
